info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 11:36AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, Pointe Coupee and East Baton Rouge Parishes.
Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting East Baton Rouge and West Baton Rouge Parishes.
For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississippi River at Baton Rouge.
* WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, The grounds of the older part of Louisiana State University's campus become soggy. This includes the area around the Veterinary Medicine building, the Veterinary Medicine Annex, the stadium and ball fields. The city of Baton Rouge and the main LSU campus are protected by levees at this level.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 32.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 40.5 feet Wednesday, April 23. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, May 02. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge, LA; West Baton Rouge, LA
